intro: Argentina millefoliolata, commonly known as the Argentine fern, is a species of fern native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its leaves are bipinnate, meaning they are divided into two sets of smaller leaflets, giving it a lacy appearance. Argentina millefoliolata plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various small organisms.
